Double-Roll

Our unique Double Roll crushing principle and segment design has resulted in improved plant efficiencies as well as increased profitability for our clients by reducing the amount of fines generated through the crushing process.

Features include

  • Reduced Fines Production
  • Reduction in Power Consumption
  • Reduction of Crusher Segment Wear
  • Maximising Desirable Product Size Distribution
  • Tramp Protection & Segment Wear

All Shumar Crushers have two machined rolls to which the crusher segments are bolted. Each Roll is generally fitted with six crusher segments; some large roll diameter primary crushers do have more segments per roll. Manganese Steel segments are used in all Primary and most secondary crushing applications. All segments are hand ground to master a drum for proper seating. One roll is fixed while the loose roll is spring loaded to minimize shock loads and damage to the crusher during a stall, resulting from non-crushable material, mostly tramp steel, being fed to the crusher.

The loose roll position can be adjusted using the adjusting spindles when product size needs to be altered or fine-tuned or when adjustment is required to compensate for wear. The loose roll bearings slide on the crusher main frame and are guided at the bottom by a wearing strip fixed to the main frame and at the top by a separate top guide arm. Phosphor bronze and steel wearing strips are provided for all sliding surfaces. The bearings are spherical roller bearings and are sealed by a taconite type labyrinth seal.

To protect the seals, the loose bearing housings are designed to pivot in the event of the roll kicking out. The lower hood is a permanent part of the frame. The outlet chute is fitted to this section of the hood. The crusher has hood seals on the hood sides, which makes the crushing chamber sealed to prevent dust escaping. The crusher is supplied with a V-belt drive, a guard and a drive stand. A pair of geared motors drives each roll independently. Both drives are situated on the same side to make the crusher more compact.

An optional extended frame can be supplied so that the crusher can be removed with its complete drive. Usually purchased with the extended frame option, is a set of rollout wheels used to roll the crusher out to a maintenance area. The rollout wheels are hydraulically extended to lift the crusher off the rails. The segments fitted to each crusher are carefully chosen to suit the customerâ€™s needs.

However, should the need arise; special segments can be designed to suit that particular application. Whilst Shumar has a reference list of over 400 units worldwide, every crusher is custom designed to the customer requirements, thereby not restricting the design stage of any installation to existing equipment dimensions. Primary Crushers Input Sizes range from 300mm to 3000mm, with Secondary and/or Intermediate Crushers having input sizes ranging from 3mm to 300mm. Primary Crushers Capacity range from 180tph to 11000tph, with the Secondary and/or Intermediate Crushers having capacities from 1tph to 4000tph, all very dependent on the duty and reduction ratio.
